intro: Sibbaldia retusa, commonly known as the narrowleaf sibbaldia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in racemes. Sibbaldia retusa is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
